function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Dependency on market value over use value of residential space","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to nature and outdoor spaces in residential buildings","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High density in residential buildings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate social distancing in indoor common areas","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate residential space for pandemic scenarios","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Abandonment of earlier housing concepts","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"General impoverishment of architectural work","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Shortcomings of existing housing stock becoming more noticeable","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Overproduction of residential buildings due to market policy","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in goods solely viewed through market value","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resilient residential model for pandemic adaptation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of specific measures for contagious disease propagation in residential buildings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complex issue requiring a thorough and integral approach","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Affirmative attitude towards residential space leading to complacency","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased exposure to pathogens in densely populated environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid dissemination of new diseases and elevated risk of pandemics","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid mutation of microorganisms and adaptation as a cause of human diseases","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Indoor work places not designed to prevent the spread of airborne pathogens","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Air distribution systems may enhance transmission of airborne pathogens","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Methods applied should be non-life threatening, user friendly, and energy efficient","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pathogen dispersal through respiratory droplets during talking, coughing, and sneezing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of respiratory droplets with deep lung pathogens during coughing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of influenza a virus and other respiratory diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Respiratory aerosols containing pathogen-carrying particles emitted during coughing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Coughed droplets with a size distribution of 0.62-15.9 mm indicating potential risk of disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"More particles retained in the sample bag during the cough droplet study, indicating potential for increased exposure to infectious particles","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"No significance found in the effect of age and gender on droplet generation, potentially leading to underestimation of transmission risk in different demographic groups","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Evaporation and dispersion of respiratory droplets","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of infectious bioaerosols from vomit and feces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variability in pathogen infectivity due to virulence, pathogen generation, and infective dose","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Survival of pathogens in the air based on environmental factors like air temperature and relative humidity","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of relative humidity on pathogenic bacteria and viruses","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of influenza a virus dependent on relative humidity","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effect of humidity on virus survival","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Positive and negative influence of temperature on virus survival","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Influenza virus transmission is more effective at lower temperatures, such as 5 c, compared to higher temperatures like 20 c or 30 c","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Enveloped viruses may have different survival patterns at different temperatures compared to non-enveloped viruses","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Public health interventions may not be sufficient to stop disease outbreaks in modern society, according to mathematical models","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne pathogens from sick person, building, or intentional release","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of dilution method","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limitations of filtration method","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Filter surface adhesion of particles reducing enzyme filter performance","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variable susceptibility of pathogens to uvgi based on cell wall presence and thickness","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of relative humidity on uvgi efficiency","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate room air mixing and uneven distribution of uv radiation","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High room relative humidity above 75%","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Adverse health effects of uvgi on humans","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of uvgi system at higher air stream velocities","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Accumulation of ’dead’ pathogens on contact surface reducing effectiveness of pco method","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Formation of secondary chemical species reducing indoor air quality","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"}]}
